rows.text: Held annually in Edinburgh, Africa in Motion is the biggest African film festival in the UK
New Media, cross-over, animation, interaction, experimental, installations.
Independent Film and New Media Art
Held annually in November, Screening, Exhibitions, AV Performances, New Media Art, http://www.anemicfestival.cz/
Held in Trebon, dedicated to animated films.
Also called "FEST", the festival is held annually in February or March.

Held annually in February parallel to the Berlin Film Festival. Mainly unusual short films with some feature presentations and installations. Accompanying program of live art and music performances. http://www.directorslounge.net/
Also called the "Berlinale", the festival is held annually in February.
Held annually in November. Emphasis on social reform movies.
Also called BUFF, the festival is held every year around September.
Annual venue for horror, thriller, and science fiction films.
Palais des Festivals et des Congrès

Held annually in October, the CinEast festival offers the most remarkable film productions (feature, documentary, animated, shorts) from the post-communist bloc, as well as numerous accompanying events (concerts, exhibitions, gastronomy etc.). http://www.cineast.lu
Held annually in April, the CinemAsia festival offers European and Dutch premieres of Asian movies (feature, documentary, animated, shorts). http://www.cinenasia.nl
Douro Film Harvest is the first totally decentralized summit of cinema that takes place in Alto Douro Wine Region, homeland of Porto Wine. http://www.dourofilmharvest.com/

The Ecologico International Film Festival (EIFF), which takes place annually in August, aims to help discover and develop independent films - social, national and international - committed to issues of contemporary society. http://ecologicofilmfestival.it/
Held annually in November, with a selected program and awards.
International fantasy, horror, action and science-fiction festival.
Annual three months outdoor Film Festival http://www.accordiedisaccordi.com
Held annually in June, the competition section is open to films from countries that produce fewer than 30 films per year.
Annual independent film festival held at the Cinema "Blow Up".
Held annually in the first week of May
Annual independent film festival held at the Cinema "Light House".
Student film, feature, documentary, animation, experimental.
Films by African directors, covering all genres.
One of the largest film festivals for kids, held annually in July, with short films and features from around the world.
Golden Apricot - Yerevan International Film Festival
Annual and largest festival in the Caucasus region.
Annual festival and awards for local television programs
The largest film festival in Scandinavia. Held annually in January to February.
International short film festival focused on Faith as a genre and subject matter.
Held annually in January or February.
Annual festival for international health and science films.
IN THE PALACE International Short Film Festival
Held annually around the end of April.
Succeeded Dublin Film Festival, which ran from 1985 to 2001. Held annually in February or March.
Underground movies, experimental music. Held annually in October.
Let's All Be Free Film Festival
A film festival dedicated to exploring what it means to be free
Largest festival in England outside London
One of the most important European forums of international LGBT film/video.
Also known as LIDF. Held annually in March/April, with extra screenings all year around.
First held in 1959, from 1959 to 1995 it was held every second year in July, and since 1995 has been held annually.
International Film Festival Message to Man
The only FIAPF accredited International Documentary, Short and Animation Film Festival held in Russia.

The only FIAPF accredited International Film Festival held in Ukraine; competition program is devoted to student, first short and first full feature films from all over the world. Held annually in October.
The Swiss event for fantastic films, Asian cinema and future images. Held annually in July.
Held annually in the end of July.

Pacific Meridian is an International Film Festival of Asian Pacific Countries. Asian-Pacific Countries are the countries surrounded by Pacific Ocean and countries of South-East Asia including India. Film Festival is held annually in one of the most beautiful places on the Pacific Ocean coast - Vladivostok. The Festival was instituted in 2003 and its 10th edition will be held this year.
Open air film festival focusing on art house, short films and media art. Held annually in August. http://www.plukdenacht.nl
The festival is held annually in a randomly selected location. Selection process is random as well.
Held annually in end of September, the festival offers a wide panorama of independent and alternative cinema from today.
Supervised by the FIAPF, the annual A category festival is one of the most important for Spanish-language cinema.
Held annually in Autumn, spotlighting movies for children and young audience http://www.ff-schlingel.de/
Also known as Sofia Film Fest. Held annually in March. Competitive specialized festival for first and second feature films.
Held annually in January, the festival is the most important film festival for Swiss cinema
Held annually in May/June. The largest film festival in the UK by number of screenings. "Honours the individual voice."
Held annually in the end of November. Known also as PÖFF. Official website www.poff.ee.
Held annually in June, it is devoted to Italian, Mediterranean and international cinema.
Short film festival held annually in May.
Supervised by the FIAPF, this category "A" film festival is held annually in the Polish capital every October.
Held annually in London, Zero Film Festival is the first and only festival exclusive to self-financed filmmakers.
